content.question: The graph of the function f shown in the figure above has a vertical tangent at the point (2,0) and horizontal tangents at the points (1, -1) and (3,1) . For what values of x, -2<x<4, is f not differentiable?

topic.text: 2.4: Connecting Differentiability and Continuity - Determining When Derivatives Do and Do Not Exist

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
